1

Can anyone in England access NHS primary care?

John 2 hours ago

2 Comments

Do you mean anyone with a British passport? John 2 hours ago

No, I am thinking about a few patients who I’ve seen recently who have a European passport. Alice 2 hours ago

Ask your own question

Post your question to the community of interest

Ask a question

2 Answers

1

If they are from the EEA then they are entitled to free NHS care. The rules are more complicated for people outside the EEA but everyone – regardless of where they are from – is entitled to free primary care.

John 2 hours ago

2 Comments

We do not register anyone without a fixed UK abode and we always ask for passports at registration. John 2 hours ago

1

Yes, NHS England guidance states anyone can access primary care, and not having proof of address should not be a barrier to this. Please see the section on entitlements for more information.

9 hours ago
1

Anyone with proof of address can register in England.

9 hours ago
